text: The burden against Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord is slow to anger and great in power,
And will not at all acquit the wicked. 
The Lord has His way
In the whirlwind and in the storm,
And the clouds are the dust of His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rebukes the sea and makes it dry,
And dries up all the rivers.
Bashan and Carmel wither,
And the flower of Lebanon wilts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains quake before Him,
The hills melt,
And the earth heaves at His presence,
Yes, the world and all who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can stand before His indignation?
And who can endure the fierceness of His anger?
His fury is poured out like fire,
And the rocks are thrown down by Him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But with an overflowing flood
He will make an utter end of its place,
And darkness will pursue His enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What do you conspire against the Lord?
He will make an utter end of it.
Affliction will not rise up a second time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For while tangled like thorns,
And while drunken like drunkards,
They shall be devoured like stubble fully dried.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From you comes forth one
Who plots evil against the Lord,
A wicked counselor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Though they are safe, and likewise many,
Yet in this manner they will be cut down
When he passes through.
Though I have afflicted you,
I will afflict you no more;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For now I will break off his yoke from you,
And burst your bonds apart.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has given a command concerning you:
“Your name shall be perpetuated no longer.
Out of the house of your gods
I will cut off the carved image and the molded image.
I will dig your grave,
For you are vile.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, on the mountains
The feet of him who brings good tidings,
Who proclaims peace!
O Judah, keep your appointed feasts,
Perform your vows.
For the wicked one shall no more pass through you;
He is utterly cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who scatters has come up before your face.
Man the fort!
Watch the road!
Strengthen your flanks!
Fortify your power mightily.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will restore the excellence of Jacob
Like the excellence of Israel,
For the emptiers have emptied them out
And ruined their vine branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The shields of his mighty men are made red,
The valiant men are in scarlet.
The chariots come with flaming torches
In the day of his preparation,
And the spears are brandished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The chariots rage in the streets,
They jostle one another in the broad roads;
They seem like torches,
They run like lightning.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The gates of the rivers are opened,
And the palace is dissolved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is decreed:
She shall be led away captive,
She shall be brought up;
And her maidservants shall lead her as with the voice of doves,
Beating their breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though Nineveh of old was like a pool of water,
Now they flee away.
“Halt! Halt!” they cry;
But no one turns back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take spoil of silver!
Take spoil of gold!
There is no end of treasure,
Or wealth of every desirable prize.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is empty, desolate, and waste!
The heart melts, and the knees shake;
Much pain is in every side,
And all their faces are drained of color.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where is the dwelling of the lions,
And the feeding place of the young lions,
Where the lion walked, the lioness and lion’s cub,
And no one made them afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs,
Killed for his lionesses,
Filled his caves with prey,
And his dens with flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, I am against you,” says the Lord of hosts, “I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword shall devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers shall be heard no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to the bloody city!
It is all full of lies and robbery.
Its victim never departs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The noise of a whip
And the noise of rattling wheels,
Of galloping horses,
Of clattering chariots!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Horsemen charge with bright sword and glittering spear.
There is a multitude of slain,
A great number of bodies,
Countless corpses—
They stumble over the corpses—
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the multitude of harlotries of the seductive harlot,
The mistress of sorceries,
Who sells nations through her harlotries,
And families through her sorceries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, I am against you,” says the Lord of hosts;
“I will lift your skirts over your face,
I will show the nations your nakedness,
And the kingdoms your shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cast abominable filth upon you,
Make you vile,
And make you a spectacle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It shall come to pass that all who look upon you
Will flee from you, and say,
‘Nineveh is laid waste!
Who will bemoan her?’
Where shall I seek comforters for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are you better than No Amon
That was situated by the River,
That had the waters around her,
Whose rampart was the sea,
Whose wall was the sea?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
All your strongholds are fig trees with ripened figs:
If they are shaken,
They fall into the mouth of the eater.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Draw your water for the siege!
Fortify your strongholds!
Go into the clay and tread the mortar!
Make strong the brick kiln!
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the fire will devour you,
The sword will cut you off;
It will eat you up like a locust. 
Make yourself many—like the locust!
Make yourself many—like the swarming locusts!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have multiplied your merchants more than the stars of heaven.
The locust plunders and flies away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commanders are like swarming locusts,
And your generals like great grasshoppers,
Which camp in the hedges on a cold day;
When the sun rises they flee away,
And the place where they are is not known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria;
Your nobles rest in the dust.
Your people are scattered on the mountains,
And no one gathers them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your injury has no healing,
Your wound is severe.
All who hear news of you
Will clap their hands over you,
For upon whom has not your wickedness passed continually?
speaker: Narrator
